FILEDESC.SOURCEDESC: Born Digital object, initially housed by the Simon Fraser University library.

ENTRY.HEADING: {Author} ({Birth_date}-{Death_date})

DATAITEM.NAME: {Name_at_birth}
DATAITEM.RESEARCHNOTE: Copy editor: break the Name above into its components inside the birthname tag below; delate the (now) empty name tag above.

DATASTRUCT.RESEARCHNOTE: Copy editor: Break individual variant names into separate dataitems/names. In all cases thoroughout the file, @@ indicates the need for a paragprah marker; change alternative names that are pseudo or pen names to the NICKNAME tag

ENTRY.HEADING: Acknowledgements
ENTRY.RESEARCHNOTE: This Heading should only appear if there are acknowledgements (from "Archives and resources" field); the "written by" should appear always...

FRONT.RESEARCHNOTE: Copy editor: if this has "revised by" in it, change the above text to conform.

AUTHORSUMMARY.HEADING: {Author} ({Birth_date}-{Death_date})
AUTHORSUMMARY.RESEARCHNOTE: Break the paragraph above into multiple paragraphs if needed. Paragraphs marked by @@

ENTRY.HEADING: Published Texts
ENTRY.RESEARCHNOTE: Copy editor: For the entire "published texts" section: Break the researchnotes under each heading below into separate bibliographic citations using the LISTBIBCIT>BIBCIT model. Where applicable, tag TITLE and XREF inside the BIBCIT. In the REF attribute of BIBCIT put the ID of the resource in the following format: "http://commons.cwrc.ca/UUID". Replace the "UUID" part with the "Identifier" value of the cited resource from the CWRC repository - a string of 32 lowercase hexadecimal digits. (object ID example: http://commons.cwrc.ca/e27a5b3a-1398-4f81-bac8-1355a4ef33a1 for the object located at: http://beta.cwrc.ca/islandora/object/islandora%3Ae27a5b3a-1398-4f81-bac8-1355a4ef33a1. If the resource is not yet included in the CWRC repository, add a RESEARCHNOTE and we will return to it once the resource has been added to the repository. Delete the now emplty research notes.

ENTRY.RESEARCHNOTE: Copy editor: separate Other Publications into the correct categories, under a heading level 3: Contributed to, edited, translated, etc. Remore the headings and the listbibcits for the categories that don't apply.
ENTRY.HEADING: Anthologized in:
Contributed to:

FAMILY.RESEARCHNOTE: Copy editor: (for all CHRONSTRUCTs): if only one date is available, use DATE instead of DATERANGE. If dates are missing altogether, replace the CHRONSTRUCT with a DATASTRUCT and the CHRONPROSE with a DATAITEM.
FAMILY.HEADING: Siblings
FAMILY.RESEARCHNOTE: {Siblings}
Copy editor: break list of sibling into individual entities using the structure below, then delete the (now) empty researchnote tag above:

CHRONSTRUCT.DATERANGE: (sibling date of birth – date of death)

FAMILY.RESEARCHNOTE: {Children1}
Copy editor: break list of children into a list of individuals using the structure below; if more than one child included, only the first child family member contains a heading tag:

FAMILYMEMBER.HEADING: Children
FAMILYMEMBER.RESEARCHNOTE: Copy editor: if more than one marriage, ": m. [name]; m. [name]; m. [name]."
FAMILYMEMBER.P: Then bio info in full sentences.

Other children: {Other_children}

Copy editor: If other children listed in the research note above, list them as individual family members below; if more than one child listed, only the first child family member contains a heading tag. Step-children, adopted children, etc. may be connected to a particualr husband. In this case, put that information in the bio "Child (dates) (relation): m. [name]. Child was the daughter of [spouse name]."

FAMILYMEMBER.RESEARCHNOTE: Copy editor: if more than one marriage, ": m. [name]; m. [name]; m. [name]."

Add an em-dash and "as [alternate name]" after "{Date awarded}) if necessary

ENTRY.HEADING: Employment and Volunteer Activities
ENTRY.RESEARCHNOTE: Copy editor: For the entire "published texts" section: Breack the researchnotes under each heading below into separate bibliographic citations using the LISTBIBCIT>BIBCIT model. Where applicable, tag TITLE and XREF inside the BIBCIT. In the REF attribute of BIBCIT put the ID of the resource in the following format: "http://commons.cwrc.ca/UUID". Replace the "UUID" part with the "Identifier" value of the cited resource from the CWRC repository - a string of 32 lowercase hexadecimal digits. (object ID example: http://commons.cwrc.ca/e27a5b3a-1398-4f81-bac8-1355a4ef33a1 for the object located at: http://beta.cwrc.ca/islandora/object/islandora%3Ae27a5b3a-1398-4f81-bac8-1355a4ef33a1. If the resource is not yet included in the CWRC repository, add a RESEARCHNOTE and we will return to it once the resource has been added to the repository. Delete the now empty research notes.
